data.text: @TruthxTexas But TEA, which quickly appointed a task force, got off to a bad start by holding its first meeting in Austin today without advance public notice and no live broadcast access. The agency didn’t even publicly announce the names of the task force members before the meeting.

@TruthxTexas I wouldn’t teach in Florida, Indiana or Texas if you doubled my salary.  It would be like teaching in Russia.  Government wants to control and punish everything you say or do.  Good luck filling those shortages.
@TruthxTexas He ain't gonna like the answers he's gonna get. I know a ton of teachers in Texas.
@TruthxTexas @BrandyforTexas Say no more beyond “banned COVID-19 safety measures.”

@TruthxTexas It is surprising they have as many teachers as they do in any state that makes teaching what they could 4 years ago criminal. Topping it off with all the other issues posters brought up and the harassment from parents at their homes and to their families, why volunteer for this?
@TruthxTexas And bans books, and keeps teen mom's pregnant.
@TruthxTexas @thejanasanchez @GregAbbott_TX @GovAbbott knows the solution to this CB problem https://t.co/GRqUff65bb
